arma

Class Arma

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.Arma

  • public class Arma
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides interfaces to non-member functions that are similar to the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library (Armadillo) by Conrad Sanderson et al., based on DenseMatrix64F from Peter Abeles' Efficient Java Matrix Library (EJML) Version 0.23 from 21.06.2013.

    If not stated otherwise (marked as non-canonical), the provided interfaces should be identical to Armadillo (e.g. same ordering of arguments, accepted values, ...). However, this project is based on EJML to provide a pure Java solution, which is why numeric results may slightly differ from the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library.

    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann
    See Also:
    Armadillo C++ Algebra Library, Efficient Java Matrix Library

      • det

        public static double det(Mat matrix)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the determinant of the provided matrix.

        Non-canonical: A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown instead of C++'s std::logic_error if the provided matrix is not square.

        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        Returns:
        The determinant.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the provided matrix is not square.

        Returns:
        The created matrix.

      • qr

        public static boolean qr(Mat q,
         Mat r,
         Mat x)
        Performs a QR decomposition on the matrix x.

        The matrix x is decomposed into a orthogonal matrix q and upper triangular matrix r, such that x = qr.

        The provided matrices q and r are not touched if the decomposition fails.

        Parameters:
        q - An orthogonal matrix.
        r - An upper triangular matrix.
        x - The matrix to be decomposed.
        Returns:
        False if the decomposition fails and true otherwise.

      • find

        public static Mat find(Mat matrix,
       int k,
       java.lang.String s)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a column vector containing indices of all non-zero elements. Contains all indices of elements that satisfy an operation if used together with Op.evaluate(Mat, Op, Mat).

        Contains all k = 0 (default) or the first (s = "first", default) respectively last ( s = "last") k indices at most.

        Only relational operators are supported.

        Non-canonical:

        • The stored indices are of type double.
        • The contained indices are either ordered from smallest to largest (s = "first") or vice versa ( s = "last").
        • An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if k is negative or strict greater then a.n_elem.
        • An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if s is neither 'first' nor 'last'.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        k - The number of elements to be evaluated.
        s - The element to to begin with.
        Returns:
        The created column vector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if k is negative or strict greater then a.n_elem as well as if s is neither 'first' nor 'last'.

      • find

        public static Mat find(Mat matrix,
       int k)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a column vector containing indices of all non-zero elements. Contains all indices of elements that satisfy an operation if used together with Op.evaluate(Mat, Op, Mat).
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        k - The number of elements to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        The created column vector.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if k is negative or strict greater then a.n_elem as well as if s is neither 'first' nor 'last'.
        See Also:
        find(Mat, int, String)

      • norm

        public static double norm(Mat matrix,
          int p)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the p-norm of the provided matrix.

        If matrix is not a vector, an induced norm is computed.

        Non-canonical:

        • An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if matrix is a vector and p is not strict greater than 0.
        • An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if matrix is not a vector and p is not one of 1, 2.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        p - The type of the norm.
        Returns:
        The norm.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if matrix is a vector and p is not strict greater than 0or if matrix is not a vector and p is not one of 1, 2.

      • norm

        public static double norm(Mat matrix,
          java.lang.String p)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the p-norm of the provided matrix.

        If matrix is not a vector, an induced norm is computed.

        "-inf" stand for the minimum norm, "inf" for the maximum norm and "fro" for the Frobenius norm.

        Non-canonical:

        • An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if matrix is a vector and p is not one of '-inf', 'inf' or 'fro'.
        • An IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if matrix is not a vector and p is not one of 'inf' or 'fro'.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        p - The type of the norm.
        Returns:
        The norm.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if matrix is a vector and p is not one of '-inf', 'inf' or 'fro' or if matrix is not a vector and p is not one of 'inf' or 'fro'.
        See Also:
        norm(Mat, int)

        public static Mat sum(Mat matrix,
      int dimension)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the sum of all elements for each col (dimension = 0, default) or row (dimension = 1) of the provided matrix.

        Non-canonical: A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if dimension is not one of 0 or 1.

        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        dimension - The direction.
        Returns:
        The sum.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if dimension is not one of 0 or 1.

      • join_rows

        public static Mat join_rows(Mat a,
            Mat b)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Concatenation of the matrices a and b along their rows. Matrix a will be placed left and b right.

        Non-canonical: A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if a.n_rows != b.n_rows.

        Parameters:
        a - First matrix.
        b - Second matrix.
        Returns:
        The concatenated matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if a.n_rows != b.n_rows.
        See Also:
        join_horiz(Mat, Mat)

      • join_cols

        public static Mat join_cols(Mat a,
            Mat b)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Concatenation of the matrices a and b along their columns. Matrix a will be placed above and b bellow.

        Non-canonical: A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if a.n_cols != b.n_cols.

        Parameters:
        a - First matrix.
        b - Second matrix.
        Returns:
        The concatenated matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if a.n_cols != b.n_cols.
        See Also:
        join_vert(Mat, Mat)

      • as_scalar

        public static double as_scalar(Mat matrix)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a provided (1,1)-matrix into a scalar of type double.

        Non-canonical: A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if matrix.n_rows > 1 || matrix.n_cols> 1.

        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        Returns:
        The scalar.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if matrix.n_rows > 1 || matrix.n_cols> 1.

      • solve

        public static Mat solve(Mat a,
        Mat b)
                 throws java.lang.RuntimeException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Solves a system of linear equations ax = b with unknown x.

        Non-canonical: A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the number of rows in a and b are unequal.

        Parameters:
        a - The matrix a.
        b - The matrix b.
        Returns:
        The matrix x.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Thrown if the algorithm was unable to solve the provided matrix.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the number of rows in a and b are unequal.

      • solve

        public static boolean solve(Mat x,
            Mat a,
            Mat b)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Solves a system of linear equations ax = b with unknown x.

        Return false if no solution was found and true otherwise. The provided matrices x is not touched if the decomposition fails.

        Non-canonical: A IllegalArgumentException exception is thrown if the number of rows in a and b are unequal.

        Parameters:
        a - The matrix a.
        b - The matrix b.
        x - The matrix x.
        Returns:
        The boolean value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Non-canonical: Thrown if the number of rows in a and b are unequal.

      • svd

        public static Mat svd(Mat x)
               throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Performs a singular value decomposition on the matrix x.

        The matrix x is decomposed into vector s such that x = u * diagmat(s) * v'. The matrices u and v are not returned.

        Parameters:
        x - The matrix to be decomposed.
        Returns:
        The matrix s.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Thrown if the algorithm was unable to solve the provided matrix.

      • svd

        public static boolean svd(Mat s,
          Mat x)
        Performs a singular value decomposition on the matrix x.

        The matrix x is decomposed into vector s such that x = u * diagmat(s) * v'. The matrices u and v are not returned.

        The provided matrix s is not touched if the decomposition fails.

        Parameters:
        s - The matrix s.
        x - The matrix to be decomposed.
        Returns:
        False if the decomposition fails and true otherwise.

      • svd

        public static boolean svd(Mat u,
          Mat s,
          Mat v,
          Mat x)
        Performs a singular value decomposition on the matrix x.

        The matrix x is decomposed into matrix u, v and a vector s such that x = u * diagmat(s) * v'.

        The provided matrices u, s and v are not touched if the decomposition fails.

        Parameters:
        u - The matrix u.
        s - The matrix s.
        v - The matrix v.
        x - The matrix to be decomposed.
        Returns:
        False if the decomposition fails and true otherwise.
